results.title: Broken journey: mending dreams
results.brief_description: A powerful and moving documentary about a family in search of itself. After 18 years in Australia, photographer Hanh Tran is making his first journey home to Vietnam. It’s a dream that has finally come true. Amidst the reunion of tears and laughter, an extraordinary family saga emerges. This film is not only a personal picture of Hanh and his family, but it also about life in contemporary Vietnam - a society in transition.

results.title: Broken Hill: a mining history 1883-1983
results.creator_credit: Terence McMahon, North Broken Hill Holdings, CRA and Terence McMahon Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a history of the Broken Hill mining industry from 1883 to the present day, incorporating documentary footage and stills of the early days, as well as comments by historian Geoffrey Blainey. Notes the early strike; the impact of technology and science in the 1920s and 30s; the mass production of fighter aircraft by BHP in the 1930s; the opening of the silver-lead smelter at Port Pirie and the steel industry at Newcastle; the introduction of company housing, health schemes and lead bonuses in the 1950s and 60s; and the intensive exploratory drilling’s for further ore deposits in the 1970s and 80s. Photography by David Olney. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Broken Hill
results.brief_description: After a brief history of mining at Broken Hill, New South Wales, shows modern mining operations there, refining of lead at Port Pirie, South Australia, and of zinc at Risdon, Tasmania, then the other industries associated with the original Broken Hill enterprises. Iron mining at Iron Knob, South Australia, the New South Wales iron and steel works at Newcastle and Port Kembla, Tasmanian copper mining and treatment, and some of the final products are shown.

results.title: Broken highway [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Laurie McInnes, Richard Mason and Black Ray Films
results.brief_description: A group of sailors aboard a merchant ship gamble and booze their way towards the Australian Coast. Among them are handsome young Angel (Aden Young), a winner to every game that Tatt’s (David Field) loses. Max (Dennis Miller), an Ancient Mariner who is close to death, instructs Angel to deliver a package to his old home in Honeyfield, Queensland, the place he remembers as paradise. He also gives him a bag of opium to appease sinister landowner Kidd (Norman Kaye). What awaits Angel is far from the tropical paradise of Max’s recollecting, although the presence of an attractive woman, Catherine (Claudia Karvan), helps matters. To confound matters and add to the inhospitability of the place, Tatt’s arrives to settle to settle a score. Cast includes Bill Hunter, Dennis Miller and David Field.

results.title: Broken harvest
results.creator_credit: Kate O'Callaghan, Maurice O'Callaghan, Jerry O'Callaghan and Destiny Films
results.brief_description: The death of his mother triggers a flashback for Jimmy O’Leary and life in Northern Ireland in the 1950’s. For Jimmy, life was a carnival with friends to play with and comics to read. His father, Arthur (Colin Lane) carries a painful grudge from the past when he fought in the Irish civil war. When Jimmy steals money from his neighbour, Josie (Niall O’Brien) during a church service, the conflict of the past resurfaces, including the revelation that Josie and Arthur fought against each other for the love of Catherine (Marian Quinn), who is now Arthur’s wife. Civil instability is rekindled in the feud that occurs between neighbours. Also starring Darren McHugh.

results.title: Broken glass
results.brief_description: Any speed is dangerous in a car accident because of the collision inside the car. The Institute of Traffic and Transport Engineering at the University of California conducts experiments to observe the effects of crashes at different speeds. The need to wear seat belts is emphasised

results.title: Broken down bus
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: An old bus lies decaying in a yard, rendered obsolete by a fleet of modern coaches. But the bus is sold and after much restoration finds new life in a kindergarten playground. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Broken blossoms [DVD]
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A young Chinese man, disillusioned by life in London, shelters the daughter of a brutish prize fighter, whom he has adored at a distance. Her father, alerted by an informer, comes after them. This is a deceptively simple chamber piece (most of it takes place in two interior sets) in contrast to the epic scale of Intolerance and Birth of a Nation. Griffith’s ties with Victorian theatre and literature were blended with the visual resources of the cinema in a new lyrically intense romanticism, the perfect context for Gish’s unforgettable portrayal of quiet vulnerability complemented by Barthelmess’s gentle emotionalism. Tinted version with musical soundtrack. Cast: Lillian Gish, Richard Barthelmess, Donald Crisp.

results.title: Broken arrow = Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, Julian Blaustein and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1870 white men and Indians are still fighting bitterly. One man, Tom Jeffords (James Stewart), is the lonely voice of conscience on the frontier, and strongly believes the Apaches are being treated unfairly. He befriends their leader Cochise (Jeff Chandler), and the two become friends as they forge negotiations to reach a truce. During this process Jeffords is called upon by a U.S. Army general to negotiate a government peace treaty, which he does successfully. The treaty comes at a high price however, when Jeffords, his Indian wife, and friend Cochise become targets of a renegade ambush. Based on the novel “Blood brother” by Elliott Arnold. Cast includes James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael.

images.caption: Broken arrow = Blood brothers (Delmer Daves) still

results.title: Broken appointment
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby, Mental Health Film Board and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: Shows the development of a young public health nurse to a mature realization of the importance of human contact between the professional and the patient and an understanding that emotional difficulties can interfere with physical welfare. The film describes the experience of a public health nurse who is attached to a baby health clinic. During the course of her work, the nurse helps a young mother to overcome the fears and worries associated with childbirth.
